definition: to get the ball rolling (abbr. for 拋磚引玉|抛砖引玉[pao1 zhuan1 yin3 yu4])
to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling

sentences.english: In doing this, more people will be inspired and encouraged to write.
sentences.chinese: 如此拋磚引玉，能激發與鼓勵更多人加入寫作隊伍。

sentences.english: The above is only the power of the individual peep-hole view, thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 以上只是個人的了一孔之見，權當拋磚引玉。

sentences.english: I'll probably do the guttering or something.
sentences.chinese: 我很可能會做些拋磚引玉的工作。

sentences.english: This research will help more and more people to study sculptural process aesthetics in the future.
sentences.chinese: 這將爲以後的雕塑過程美學研究拋磚引玉。

sentences.english: Common examples include solid linear brick and solid parabolic tetrahedral elements.
sentences.chinese: 常見的例子包括固體線性拋磚和固體四面體組成部分。
